lead_paragraph: The burning of straw is a major contributor to New Delhi’s winter air pollution, and it could be stopped if the government got serious.

headline.print_headline: Outlawed Crop Fires Fuel India’s Air Pollution
headline.main: Farmers’ Unchecked Crop Burning Fuels India’s Air Pollution

snippet: The burning of straw is a major contributor to New Delhi’s winter air pollution, and it could be stopped if the government got serious....
abstract: Farmers in Indian states of Punjab and Haryana continue to set fire to leftover straw from rice harvest to make room for winter wheat crop, exacerbating air pollution in New Delhi, which has one of the worst air quality in world; country's environmental court has told government to forbid burning of straw, but there has been little abatement since alternative methods for straw disposal are too expensive for farmers.
